events.title: The Sergeant's Test
events.setup: {SERGEANT} pulls you aside after camp is set. 'The men look up to you now, {PLAYER_NAME}. But leading isn't just about fighting. Tell me — a recruit loses his rations gambling. What do you do?'

options.text: "Discipline him publicly. The men need to see consequences."
options.tooltip: Hardline approach. Adds 1 discipline. Disciplinarian tag.
options.resultText: {SERGEANT} nods slowly. 'Hard but fair. The men will respect that. You're ready for the next rank, {NEXT_RANK}.'

options.text: "Give him a chance to earn it back. One mistake shouldn't define a man."
options.tooltip: Merciful approach. +5 Soldier rep. Merciful tag.
options.resultText: {SERGEANT} smiles faintly. 'Compassion has its place. The men will remember your kindness. Welcome to {NEXT_RANK}.'

options.text: "Make him work extra duties until the debt is paid. Idle hands cause trouble."
options.resultText: {SERGEANT} chuckles. 'Practical. I like it. You think like a soldier should. Congratulations, {NEXT_RANK}.'

events.title: Crisis of Command
events.setup:
The battle was chaos. {SERGEANT} went down with an arrow to the shoulder, and the line wavered. For a moment, all eyes turned to you. Now, in the aftermath, {LORD_NAME} summons you.

'I heard what happened out there,' the lord says. 'The men say you held them together. Tell me what you did.'

options.text: "I led the charge. We couldn't let them regroup."
options.tooltip: Aggressive leadership. Aggressive tag. Promotes to Tier 4.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} nods approvingly. 'Bold action wins wars. You've earned your place among the {NEXT_RANK}s. Don't let me down.'

options.text: "I held the line and protected the wounded. We couldn't abandon our own."
options.tooltip: Protective leadership. +5 Soldier rep. Defender tag. Promotes to Tier 4.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} regards you thoughtfully. 'Loyalty to your comrades is rare these days. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} suits you. Lead them well.'

options.text: "I read the battlefield and ordered a tactical withdrawal to better ground."
options.tooltip: Calculating leadership. Tactician tag. Promotes to Tier 4.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME}'s eyes narrow with respect. 'A thinking soldier. We need more of those. You're {NEXT_RANK} now. Use that head of yours.'

events.title: The Squad's Vote
events.setup:
The veterans of your squad gather around the fire. {SERGEANT} stands and clears his throat.

'We've been watching you, {PLAYER_NAME}. Some of us think you're ready to wear the stripes of {NEXT_RANK}. But rank isn't given — it's earned by the trust of those you lead.'

The men look to you expectantly. This is your moment to speak.

options.text: "I'm nothing without this squad. Whatever you decide, I'll accept."
options.tooltip: Defer to the squad. +10 Soldier rep. Promotes to Tier 5.
options.resultText: The men exchange glances and nod. {SERGEANT} claps you on the shoulder. 'That's the right answer. Welcome to {NEXT_RANK}, soldier. The squad has spoken.'

options.text: "I've bled with you. Fought beside you. I'm ready to lead you."
options.resultText: {SERGEANT} grins. 'Confidence. Good. A {NEXT_RANK} needs that.' The veterans raise their cups. 'To {PLAYER_NAME}!'

options.text: "Give me the chance, and I swear no one in this squad goes hungry or forgotten."
options.tooltip: Promise care. +5 Soldier rep. Protector tag. Promotes to Tier 5.
options.resultText: Silence falls. Then {SECOND_SHORT} stands. 'I believe him.' One by one, the others nod. {SERGEANT} smiles. 'Then it's decided. {NEXT_RANK} {PLAYER_NAME}.'

events.title: Audience with the Lord
events.setup:
{LORD_NAME} summons you to the pavilion. The banner of {FACTION_NAME} hangs behind the campaign table where the lord sits reviewing dispatches.

'You've served well, {PLAYER_NAME}. Your name comes up often in the reports. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} is mine to give — but first, I must know where your loyalty lies.'

options.text: "My sword belongs to you, my lord. Command, and I obey."
options.tooltip: Personal loyalty. Lord Sworn tag. Promotes to Tier 6.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} rises and draws a blade, touching it to your shoulder. 'Then rise, {NEXT_RANK}. Your oath is accepted. Serve me well, and glory shall be yours.'

options.text: "My loyalty is to {KINGDOM_NAME} and its people. I serve the realm."
options.tooltip: Kingdom loyalty. Realm Loyal tag. Promotes to Tier 6.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} pauses, then nods slowly. 'A principled answer. The realm needs soldiers like you. You are {NEXT_RANK} now. May you serve the kingdom with honor.'

options.text: "My loyalty is to the soldiers beside me. They're why I fight."
options.tooltip: Camaraderie. +10 Soldier rep. Lance Bound tag. Promotes to Tier 6.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} studies you for a long moment. 'Rare, to find such devotion to the common soldier. Very well, {NEXT_RANK}. Lead your men. I suspect they'd follow you anywhere.'

events.title: Commander's Commission
events.setup:
{LORD_NAME} summons you. Maps are spread across the table, markers showing troop positions.

'You've proven yourself, {PLAYER_NAME}. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} comes with command — twenty soldiers, yours to lead. This is no small responsibility. Are you ready?'

options.text: "I'm ready, my lord. Give me the command."
options.tooltip: Accept command of 20 soldiers. Promotes to Tier 7.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} nods with satisfaction. 'Good. I've assigned twenty recruits to your command. Train them well — they're green, but they're yours. Make them into soldiers worthy of {FACTION_NAME}.'

options.text: "I'm honored, but I'm not ready to lead men yet."
options.tooltip: Decline promotion. Cautious tag. Re-apply later via dialogue.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} studies you carefully. 'An honest answer. Command isn't for everyone, and it's better to know that now than in battle. The offer stands — when you're ready, speak to me.'

events.title: Expanded Command
events.setup:
{LORD_NAME} finds you after the morning drills. Your retinue has performed well.

'Your soldiers fight like veterans, {PLAYER_NAME}. I'm impressed. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} comes with expanded command — ten more soldiers to add to your retinue. You've earned this.'

options.text: "Thank you, my lord. I'll put them to good use."
options.tooltip: Add 10 soldiers to retinue (30 total). Promotes to Tier 8.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} clasps your shoulder. 'Good. Ten more recruits have been assigned to your command. You've proven you can lead — now prove you can lead more.'

options.text: "I'd prefer to master what I have before taking on more."
options.tooltip: Decline expansion for now. You can request promotion later.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} nods slowly. 'Wisdom, perhaps. The offer stands when you're ready. Your current retinue is strong — keep it that way.'

events.title: Elite Commander
events.setup:
{LORD_NAME} calls you to the command tent. The other officers regard you with respect.

'{PLAYER_NAME}, you've become one of my most capable commanders. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} is the highest a soldier can achieve in my service. Forty soldiers will answer to your command — an elite force within my army. Are you prepared for this responsibility?'

options.text: "I've trained for this moment. I'm ready."
options.tooltip: Add 10 soldiers to retinue (40 total). Promotes to Tier 9.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} stands and extends their hand. 'Welcome to the highest ranks, Commander. Ten more soldiers join your retinue. Lead them well — your legend is just beginning.'

options.text: "The honor is mine. I'll make you proud, my lord."
options.tooltip: +5 Lord rep. Add 10 soldiers to retinue (40 total). Promotes to Tier 9.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} smiles approvingly. 'Humility in a commander is rare. The men will respect you for it. Ten more soldiers are yours — lead them as you've led the rest.'

options.text: "I'm content with what I have. Perhaps another time."
options.tooltip: Decline elite rank for now. You can request promotion later.
options.resultText: {LORD_NAME} raises an eyebrow but accepts your decision. 'Very well. The offer remains when you change your mind. Few turn down such an honor, but I respect your judgment.'
